posts.title: Prada & Oakley Design Next-Gen Spacesuit for NASA's Artemis III
posts.excerpt: Prada and Oakley join forces with Axiom Space to design NASA’s Artemis III spacesuit — blending cutting-edge safety, innovation, and luxury design for a historic Moon mission in 2026.
posts.body:
Prada and Oakley have partnered with Axiom Space to create the next-generation spacesuit for NASA’s upcoming Artemis III mission — which will send the first woman, person of color, and non-American to the Moon’s south pole.

Prada contributed its expertise in high-performance materials and precision design to develop a suit that is durable, functional, and visually striking. Meanwhile, Oakley is crafting advanced visors with enhanced optics and protection, ensuring astronauts have unparalleled visibility and safety in one of the harshest environments imaginable.

The result is a technologically advanced suit that merges safety, innovation, and fashion — a bold statement on how style can exist even in space. Every seam, material choice, and design detail serves a purpose, balancing form and function with astronaut mobility and comfort.

Set to be ready for the 2026 mission, the suit symbolizes how cross-industry collaboration can push human boundaries. It’s not just a leap forward for space exploration — it’s a cultural moment that unites science, technology, and luxury design under one mission: to make history on the Moon.
